summary: The document details the employment and payroll authorization of Margo E. Jackson by the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), including her role as a Document Clerk, salary adjustments, and the administrative processes involved. It also notes the partial postponement of document release due to privacy concerns related to Social Security numbers, with a next review date set for 2017.
key_findings: Margo E. Jackson was appointed as a Document Clerk for the Research/Document Unit of the HSCA, starting June 1, 1977, with an initial salary of $10,000 per year.
The document outlines the payroll authorization process, including salary adjustments and position changes within the HSCA.
Privacy concerns, particularly regarding Social Security numbers, resulted in partial postponements of the document's release, with a scheduled review in 2017.

Insight is provided into the administrative procedures of the U.S. House of Representatives, including the certification of employee relationships to Members of Congress and the approval process for committee employees.
